title: iCloud Calendar disruption with Firefox - backspace
content:
Recently I contacted Apple with the unusual issue of not being able to use the "backspace" key in the iCloud Calendar. If I open iCloud for browser and use other Apple iCloud features such as Reminders, then the backspace key works fine. If I open iCloud Calendar then I can no longer use the backspace key.

Here is what we know:

  • I've already opened iCloud in other browsers including Google Chrome, Duck Duck Go, and Edge, and the problem does not exist. It is unique to Firefox.
  • Apple has had a number of users contact them with the same issue and it's beyond the control of Apple.
  • The issue is unique to Firefox running the iCloud for browser interface, specifically for Calendar
  • The delete key works fine if I move the cursor to the left of the text to be removed. It's only the backspace button

When we can see a software patch to resolve this issue?

Windows 11, HP, Firefox 118.0.1 Apple Case ID: 102110139284
creator: bronsonchadwick

title: Widows 10 firefox suddenly not connect to Internet error, only work for a while after reboot. New profile not work
content:
My computer is Widnows 10 Pro, firefox have been running well for years. Since yesterday, it starts to show:

Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site.

We can’t connect to the server at www.youtube.com.

If you entered the right address, you can: 

   Try again later    Check your network connection    Check that Firefox has permission to access the web (you might be connected but behind a firewall)

No matter which site I go, same error. I have tried creating a new profile, disabled firewall, no proxy, no extension, even uninstall/reinstall firefox. Issue remain the same. Only time it works is right after I reboot the computer, then it works for a while (somewhere around 5-10 minutes). Computer never sleep, and it will acts up during my browsing. All my other browsers, outlook or application that access the internet works fine. Windows Defender scan no virus.

title: Código suspeito inserido automáticamente
content:
Bom dia Suporte,

Meu nome é Raul e sou desenvolvedor wordpress, o que ocorre é que sempre que estou editando as páginas de post, automaticamente insere um código javascript nos posts, que tem que remover. Não sei se vem das extensões ou do próprio navegador, e parece que o código tenta ligar camera e microfone pela aplicação. O código vem deste link: moz-extension://c07436e9-7860-4084-a29a-70ec73b1573d/js/app.js sempre, como atributo src e dentro de uma tag script. Como está escrito moz-extension, acredito que seja de alguma das extensões instaladas no navegador. Porém, não possível para mim, saber de qual. Segue print das minhas extensões ativadas e desativadas. Eu penso que é a do google tradutor, mas, de fato, não sei.


Atenciosamente, Raul
creator: raulferreiradarocha

title: Is there a way to disable the Mozilla Firefox file dialog like in Google Chrome?
content:
I'm looking for a way to disable the file dialog popup that appears when a user clicks on, for instance, an "Upload File" button on a website.

In Google Chrome, we achieve this by setting the "AllowFileSelectionDialogs" policy to 0 in the registry. Unfortunately, it seems that Firefox does not offer a similar functionality. The operating system will be Windows 10.

Is there any way to achieve this in Firefox?

title: Request for Assistance with Mozilla Firefox Performance Issues
content:
Dear Mozilla Firefox Support Team,

I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to express my concerns and seek assistance with some persistent performance issues I have been experiencing while using Mozilla Firefox.

Over the past few weeks, I have noticed a significant decline in the performance of Mozilla Firefox, specifically in terms of webpage loading times and the functionality of multimedia content, such as videos. Many websites that used to load quickly now take an unusually long time to open, and, in some cases, they do not load at all. Additionally, when attempting to stream videos, I encounter frequent buffering and playback issues, which have not been a problem when using alternative web browsers.

I have been a loyal user of Mozilla Firefox for many years and greatly appreciate the browser's commitment to privacy and security. However, the recent performance issues I have encountered are affecting my productivity and overall browsing experience. I have attempted to troubleshoot these issues on my own by clearing my browser cache, disabling extensions, and updating Firefox to the latest version. Despite these efforts, the problems persist.

I am writing to request your assistance in resolving these issues and restoring the smooth and efficient performance of Mozilla Firefox on my system. I rely on this browser for various online activities, including work-related tasks and research, and the current situation is hindering my ability to do so effectively.

To help diagnose and address these problems, I have included some relevant information about my system below: 

   Operating System: Windows 11    Mozilla Firefox Version: Latest    Internet Connection: 50mbps of fiber optic connection

I kindly request that your support team investigate the issues I have described and provide guidance on how to resolve them. If any additional information or diagnostics are needed from my end, please do not hesitate to let me know, and I will gladly cooperate in any way possible.

I value Mozilla Firefox as a browser and hope to continue using it as my preferred choice. Your prompt attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated. Please respond to this letter at your earliest convenience, either by email or through any other preferred method of communication.

Thank you for your time and assistance in addressing these performance issues. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of the problems I am encountering.
creator: shahzebjadoon31.sj

title: Unable to scroll to beginning of Youtube sub list
content: I used to be able to scroll to the bottom of my Youtube subscription list, to see the very first posted videos of all of my subscriptions, going back to the first days of Youtube in 2005. Granted, not all of the videos would show up, and I don't know if that is a Youtube problem or a Firefox problem, but most of the videos would be there. Now, after going back less than a year in the archive, the scrolling just kind of peters out. Firefox becomes unresponsive to any key press or mouse click, and all I can do is quit the program. What has changed? Has Firefox gotten even worse at memory management? it was always a total pig with memory, but has it reached the point where it just plain malfunctions and can't recover? If that is the case, then Firefox devs had better get their spit together and work on optimization. I really don't want to have to start using Edge, thank you, no. I only use Edge to view PDFs.
creator: kurtfaasse

title: Don't close tabs on exit
content:
I prefer to have all my previous tabs open when I start up Firefox, which means that I don't want them to close upon exit. Recently, Firefox started closing my tabs upon exit, even though:

- I have the option "Firefox will remember history" selected 

- I do not open in Private Browsing mode

What other settings do I need to change? Debra
